result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis J Cosby

records.addlTxt: 11:25 AM Defendant Curtis J Cosby in court.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Curtis J Cosby.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to Count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Deferred Prosecution Program.  Bail continued.

8:56 AM Defendant Curtis J Cosby in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark A Leonard in court for Curtis J Cosby.  Attorney Frank John Remington in court for State of Wisconsin. Motion to quash, State has no objection. CT quashes warrant. Warrants emailed. Defn request DPU plea, notice given in CT.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:11 AM Defendant appeared.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
